Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 87 Seventh Avenue South Community Board 2 Application 20065428 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe , Sushi Samba, Manhattan (20065428TCM)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 050375 MMQ, a change to the city map; an amendment to the Zoning Map, C 060325 ZSQ, C 060326 ZSQ, C 060327 ZSQ and N060328 ZAQ; and shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application no. N 060324 ZRQ that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Silvercup West Studios, Queens (C050375MMQ)

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz:

This application is related to application no. N 040544 ZRM that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of homeless services to conduct an annual survey of the unsheltered homeless population citywide
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of homeless services to conduct an annual survey of the unsheltered homeless population citywide.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing the council to direct the landmarks preservation commission to hold a public hearing on a proposed designation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
Items.MatterName: Allowing the council to direct the landmarks preservation commission to hold a public hearing on a proposed designation.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Public Service Commission to allow individual apartments to access real-time energy pricing through the use of smart meters.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Public Service Commission to allow individual apartments to access real-time energy pricing through the use of smart meters.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Senate to adopt S.2210-B, which would require every truck, tractor, and tractor-trailer or semitrailer registered in New York State with a gross weight of 18,000 pounds or more to be equipped with a convex mirror on the front of such vehicle or combination of vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: NYS Senate to adopt S.2210-B, which would require every truck, tractor, and tractor-trailer or semitrailer registered in NYS with a gross weight of 18,000 pounds or more to be equipped with a convex mirror on the front of such vehicle.

Items.Title: Resolution calling for the inclusion of a Greenway Director within the proposed Mayor’s Office of Sustainability to coordinate and oversee the planning, implementation, operations and development of the City’s greenway network.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Inclusion of a Greenway Director within the proposed Mayor’s Office of Sustainability.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting any motor vehicle other than a passenger car to park within fifteen feet of a street corner.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting any motor vehicle other than a passenger car to park within fifteen feet of a street corner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the office of operations, the office of environmental coordination and an office of long-term planning and sustainability.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Creation and implementation of a comprehensive environmental sustainability action plan for NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and New York State Legislature to execute an amended Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) for the distribution of the second round of funding for the Brownfield Opportunity Areas Program (BOA), and to provide in such amended MOU for projects already awarded grants to receive such funds and proceed without unnecessary delay, and for projects that are consistent with the BOA plans to be given priority and preference for funding from State agencies.
